Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Rhomboid minor C6 & C7 SP Medial border of scapula (above scapular spine) Dorsal scapular n.
C4 - C5		 Scapula: Retraction, Downward rotation, Stabilization
``` ::: ::: # Overview The rhomboid minor is a cylindrically shaped muscle @jonesProjectFoundations2025 consisting of 2 layers: [dorsal and ventral](#insertion). # Origin {#origin} SP of C6 & C7 @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ::: {.callout-note} Some individuals have a *rhomboid occipitalis* which ascends between the rhomboid minor and occipital bone @jonesProjectFoundations2025. ::: # Insertion {#insertion} - **Ventral layer**: Blends into the [levator scapulae]({{< var ref-levator-scapulae.path >}}) and [serratus anterior]({{< var ref-serratus-anterior.path >}}) @jonesProjectFoundations2025. - **Dorsal layer**: Medial border of scapula (*above scapular spine*) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ![Left scapula (Posterior view) @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Osteology/image203 gray1918 Left scapula. Dorsal surface.gif){#fig-gray1918-image203} # Innervation {#innervation} [Dorsal Scapular N.]({{< var ref-dorsal-scapular-nerve.path >}}) ([C4]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c4 >}}), [C5]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c5 >}})) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} **STJ**: Retraction, Downward rotation, Stabilization @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Notes # Function The Serratus Anterior (along with the rhomboids) serves to aid in scapular stability during arm elevation @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020 ![Superior View of the shoulder: You can see how the rhomboids and SA both actively stabilize the scapulothoracic joint by pulling the scapula towards the thoracic wall @duttonDuttonOrthopaedicExamination2020](/The Archive/Anatomy/Skeletal Muscles/Upper Limb Muscles/Axioappendicular Posterior Muscles/images/Dutton fig16.2 Superior aspect of shoulder.png) # Release {#release} Compressing the rhomboid against the ribcage is not the most effective way to release this muscle. It is better to stabilize the scapula with one hand and drive the fingertips of the other hand anterolaterally deep to the scapula in order to apply a stretch @jonesProjectFoundations2025. # Paralysis {#paralysis} Rhomboid paralysis can result in a separation of the scapula from the thoracic wall, known as a "scapular winging sign" @jonesProjectFoundations2025.
